org.lemming.math

Class SubpixelLocalization

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lemming.math.SubpixelLocalization

  • public class SubpixelLocalization
extends java.lang.Object
    Refine a set of peaks to subpixel coordinates. Single-threaded version.

    A List RefinedPeak for the given list of Localizable is computed by, for each peak, fitting a quadratic function to the image and computing the subpixel coordinates of the extremum. This is an iterative procedure. If the extremum is shifted more than 0.5 in one or more the fit is repeated at the corresponding integer coordinates. This is repeated to convergence, for a maximum number of iterations, or until the integer coordinates move out of the valid image.

      • quadraticFitOffset

        protected static <T extends net.imglib2.type.numeric.RealType<T>> void quadraticFitOffset(net.imglib2.Localizable p,
                                                                                          net.imglib2.RandomAccess<T> access,
                                                                                          Jama.Matrix g,
                                                                                          Jama.Matrix H,
                                                                                          net.imglib2.RealPositionable offset)
        Estimate subpixel offset of extremum of quadratic function fitted at p.
        Type Parameters:
        T - data type
        Parameters:
        p - integer position at which to fit quadratic.
        access - access to the image values.
        g - a n vector where n is the dimensionality of the image. (This is a temporary variable to store the gradient).
        H - a n × n matrix where n is the dimensionality of the image. (This is a temporary variable to store the Hessian).
        offset - subpixel offset of extremum value p is stored here.
